column5: Headed out on lake Scugog Sunday morning with a fellow board member grilw(Greg). Tried for some musky....first spot had a small guy follow a spinner bait to the boat. After a few rock bass moved to the mouth of the Noguon river...hmm nothing. On to the next spot...Greg nailed this one on a perch pattern husky jerk.    About an hour later while moving along with the electric motor I see 2 muskies take off in opposite directions. Start casting to the direction one of them headed and this guy hit.    Along with those fish we had tons of panfish and 2 largemouth to keep us busy.
Nice Job guys. Nice early season skis.
Nice. That second one looks like a musky with a desk job. LOL not a mark on it. Awesome.
Awesome stuff guys!  That lake can be tough at times...great to see success there!
Two very decent looking Muskys there.. These Scugog Musky reports are really making me itch to get myself up there and give er' a go..
Great to see the bog represented in all these musky reports.   Love fishing that lake even the weeds drive me batty at times.
yea im heading up their this weekend my old creek chub lures need more war wounds on them. so many musky's in scugog!
Great looking fish. It's been awhile since I tried for a Scugog ski, maybe later this week.
Weeds aren't too bad yet...give it 4 weeks and you'll be cleaning your prop as often as you are picking weeds off your lure....hehe.
Nice fish guys, great to see greg still alive and kicking as well
Great report and nice musky! I was wondering what happened to Greg. Did you guys get caught in that freak storm????

Totally missed this report!  It sure was a heckuva day. What was supposed to be a day with thunderstorms and rain turned out to be nothing but sunshine, which also meant that the muskie/walleye fishing shut right down.  Saturday can't get here soon enough!
